info.title: Signature API
info.description: Provides a interface for partners to place orders through the Deliveroo network

post.description: Create a new order for fulfillment by Deliveroo. A new order is returned with the `accepted` status.

id.description: If provided, sets a case-sensitive order id (otherwise one will be generated for you). The identifier must consist of letters, numbers, dashes, and underscores only.

fulfillment_type.description: Either `delivery` (default) or `pickup` Note: pickup orders are not yet supported.
fulfillment_type.title: FulfillmentType

partner_fee_fractional.description: The price of all fees charged to the customer in the currency's smallest subunit, e.g. pence for GBP. This information is required if Customer Support is managed by Deliveroo so customers can be accurately compensated.

items.description: A list of items the customer wishes to order

scheduled_webhook_events.title: ScheduledWebhookEvents
scheduled_webhook_events.description: For test mode. Simulates webhook events with a given status to occur after a given delay after the order is created. Multiple webhooks of the same status may be triggered.

delivered_place.title: DeliveredPlace
delivered_place.description: The place that the rider left the delivery payload if they could not make contact with the customer.

total_price.description: Total order value, including basket subtotal and partner fee.

schema.title: OrderLocationV1Response
schema.description: Provides details about the location of the order and the estimated delivery time

accuracy_in_meters.title: AccuracyInMeters
accuracy_in_meters.description: The accuracy of the lat/lon coordinates in meters.

at.description: The date/time the location was last updated

stacked_with.description: This field is deprecated. Please use delivery_stack instead.

delivery_priority.description: This field is deprecated. Please use delivery_stack instead.

rider_full_name.title: RiderFullName
rider_full_name.description: Rider's full name or "Deliveroo Rider", if rider anonymisation has been enabled for partner.

rider_contact_number.description:
Phone number the partner/restaurant can use to contact the rider. This should not be shared with or used by the customer.

Riders can have their personal phone numbers protected (masked), in which case, a temporary phone number and code will be assigned to `rider_bridge_number` and `rider_bridge_code`. In this case, `rider_contact_number` will be formatted as `rider_bridge_number (rider_bridge_code)`. When the rider's phone is unmasked, `rider_bridge_number` and `rider_bridge_code` will be null.

rider_bridge_code.title: RiderBridgeCode
rider_bridge_code.description: When rider's have their phone number masked, this value should be used when calling their temporary phone number.

rider_bridge_number.title: RiderBridgeNumber
rider_bridge_number.description: A rider may have their personal phone number protected (masked), in which case the rider's temporary phone number and code will be assigned to `bridge_number`.

customer_to_rider_contact_number.description: Phone number the customer can use to contact the rider.

get.description:
Gets the current location of the order's delivery rider along with their name and contact numbers, if available.

You can use this endpoint to render tracking maps for customers or an approximate progress bar based on travel distance remaining. If the location isn't available, the order may not have a delivery rider yet.
The best time to begin using this endpoint is after you've received a `rider_assigned` order status webhook callback. Riders can be subject to change after assignment, for this reason contact information should only
be passed to the customer after the order has been collected. If another rider is assigned a new rider_assigned status will be sent via webhook callback, use this endpoint to call for new rider contact information.

The location data does not update more than every minute, so it's unnecessary to poll more frequently. It will stop providing location data once any terminal order status is reached (delivered, undeliverable, canceled).

post.description:
It is recommended to create a quote before placing an order as during quote creation multiple validation steps are performed and errors that might result in order rejection can be avoided.

It is important to note that a quote is only valid for 5 minutes and after this a new quote must be created before placing the order, otherwise an error will be returned.

When a quote is created, Deliveroo validates the delivery location, that can be represented either as latitude/longitude or using a textual representation of the address.

lat.description: Required if address is not provided.

lon.description: Required if address is not provided.

address.description: Required if lat/lon is not provided.
address.title: Address

country_code.description: 2-letter country code according to ISO 3166-1 alpha-2 format.
country_code.title: CountryCode2

door_code.description: Customer provided door code, such as one for entering a shared apartment.

line2.description: Apartment, suite, unit, building, floor, etc.

full.title: AddressFull
full.description: Can be used in lieu of supplying line1/line2/postcode.

created.description: A textual representation of the time value formatted according to the RFC3339 format

examples.delivery_note: Door bell is broken, please knock

lat.description: Can be used to exactly specify the latitude of the delivery location. If supplied, `address.lon` must also be supplied.

lon.description: Can be used to exactly specify the longitude of the delivery location. If supplied, `address.lat` must also be supplied.

estimated_duration.title: EstimatedOrderDuration
estimated_duration.description: The estimated minimum and maximum time to deliver this order

estimated_rider_arrival_time.title: Duration
estimated_rider_arrival_time.description: A duration string is a possibly signed sequence of decimal numbers, each with optional fraction and a unit suffix, such as "300ms", "-1.5h" or "2h45m". Valid time units are "ns", "us" (or "Âµs"), "ms", "s", "m", "h".

400.description: The request didn't work, often because a required parameter is missing or the content-type hasn't been set e.g. an incorrect JSON request

401.description: The request didn't work because the combination of your API key and API token doesn't exist in our system or your integration has been disabled

get.description:
Returns a list of sites that deliver to a given location, which can be represented either as latitude/longitude or using the combination of postcode and country code.

A site must not be presented as an option to the customer if the attribute `visible` is set as `false` as Deliveroo will not be able to fulfil the order as the site is either closed or there is no rider available in the area at the moment.

An example request will look as follows:
```
GET https://partners.deliveroo.com/api/v1/fulfillment/restaurants?lat=51.513822&lon=-0.191615&postcode=EC4R3TE&brand_id=brand-id&country_code=GB
```

parameters.name: include_test_sites
parameters.description: For test mode. If true, test restaurants are included in the response.

200.description: A list of Restaurants that deliver to the specified location.

schema.description:
An array of Restaurants which you can order from.

If delivery fee cannot currently be retrieved for a site, the value of `currency_code` becomes `""` (empty string) and the value of `fractional` becomes `0`. This occurs, for example, for sites currently closed.

distance.description: The straightline distance to the Restaurant in meters

estimated_duration.description:
When the estimated duration exceeds one hour,  begin or end will be prefixed with hour
mark, as in the following example: `1h10m0s`.

location.description: The latitude and longitude of the location
location.title: LatLon

name.description: The internal name of the Restaurant

display_name.description: The display name of the Restaurant. Can be used to display the name of the restaurant to customers.

status.description: If the Restaurant is accepting orders this will be `available`, otherwise will return `unavailable`

visible.description:
If the value of the visible flag is set to false, Deliveroo cannot
currently deliver from this site. This may occur when there is no available riders

get.description: Get a list of currently registered webhooks.

post.description:
Update the webhook URLs configured for your integrator. If a particular webhook is omitted or set to `null`, it will not be updated. Webhooks can be set to an empty string (`""`), in which case it will no longer be triggered.

If you do not wish to receive order status updates (and perhaps poll the order endpoint instead), you can omit the `status_url`.

refund_url.description: The URL to call when a refund is requested.

credit_url.description: The URL to call when a credit is requested.

redelivery_url.description: The URL to call when a redelivery event occurs.

status_url.description: The URL to call when the status of an order changes.

rider_status_url.description: The URL to call to inform of rider status changes (arrived at restaurant, picked up order)

post.summary: Submit a refund notification for an order
post.description:
If you are using your own customer support service, this can be used to notify us of refunds you have given to customers for which Deliveroo are liable. Refund notifications are processed in the background and will be subsequently be rejected if the requested amount exceeds the total order value (including delivery fees). Multiple refund notifications may be submitted for a single order, but their sum total should not exceed the total order value.

Use the refund webhook to be notified when refund notifications submitted via this method have been ingested and processed successfully by Deliveroo.

fractional.description: Amount in cents, e.g. `400` for 4 GBP

post.description:
Create a new order for fulfillment by Deliveroo. A new order is returned with the `accepted` status.

_Unlike v1, this endpoint supports [idempotency](https://api-docs.deliveroo.com/docs/signature-idempotent-requests)._

fulfillment_type.description: Either `delivery` (default) or `pickup`. Note: pickup orders are not yet supported.

quote_id.description: If a quote was created then use its Id to prevent validation errors

partner_fee_fractional.description: The price of all fees charged to the customer in the currency's smallest subunit, e.g. pence for GBP. This information is required if Customer Support is managed by Deliveroo so customers can be accurately compensated.

items.description: A list of items the customer wishes to order

Door bell is broken, please knock

customer.description: At least one of `first_name` and `last_name` must be provided.
customer.title: Customer

id.title: CustomerID
id.description: External unique customer identifier, used to correlate orders from the same person.

preferred_name.description: Customer preferred name used to greet the customer. First name will be used if omitted.

drinking_age_confirmed.description: *Required if the order item has `contains_alcohol: true`*. Customer has confirmed they are able to show proof of age by valid ID to receive these items; otherwise they will not be delivered.

id.description: The unique ID for the menu item.
id.title: UniqueID

items.description: An array of modifiers to the current menu item.

id.description: The unique ID for the modifier.

parent_id.description: The ID of the item or modifier to which this modifier corresponds. If not provided, it will default to the parent item.

short_id.description: Short ID provided by partner for this order.

at.description: Timestamp when the given event occurred.

stacked_with.description: A list of order ids this order is stacked with
stacked_with.title: StackedWith

get.description:
This endpoint provides more detailed information about the riders that are assigned to a given order.

Compared to v1, this endpoint supports multiple riders as well as a `status_log` array containing the events that occurred for each rider. It is important to note that if the rider anonymisation setting has been enabled for the partner, the rider's actual name will be replaced with "Deliveroo Rider".

The following table explains rider statuses.

| Rider Status | Description |
| -- | -- |
| `rider_assigned` | Rider was assigned to the order. |
| `rider_unassigned` | Rider was unassigned to the order. |
| `rider_arrived` | Rider nearby to the restaurant. |
| `rider_confirmed_at_restaurant` | Rider arrival at the restaurant confirmed on rider's app. |
| `rider_in_transit` | Rider en route to the customer. |
| `rider_nearby` | Rider is arriving at customer. |

stacked_with.description: This field is deprecated. Please use delivery_stack instead.

delivery_priority.description: This field is deprecated. Please use delivery_stack instead.

404.description: Resource was not found in our systems.

500.description: Something went wrong on our end. You'll have to try again later once we've fixed it.

parameters.name: x-deliveroo-sequence-guid
parameters.description: Deliveroo Sequential globally unique identifier (GUID). Please implement it as case-insensitive.

parameters.name: x-deliveroo-hmac-sha256
parameters.description: On registration, we'll provide you with a webhook secret. We'll use the webhook secret and a sequential globally unique identifier (GUID) to generate a hash of the order payload. When you receive a POST request, you will be able to compute a hash and verify that it's a genuine, authorized request sent from Deliveroo. Please implement it as case-insensitive.

at.description: Date and time in the ISO-8601 format when the order event changed.

allOf.description: Status of the order. Can be pending, placed, accepted, confirmed (for scheduled orders), rejected or canceled.

delivered_place.title: DeliveredPlace
delivered_place.description: Will be passed only when rider had problems delivering the order.

delivery_eta.title: OrderDeliveryEstimates
delivery_eta.description: Provides an estimated delivery window for the order

The restaurant must return a valid response in order for the API to successfully process and create the new order

delivery_priority.description: This field is deprecated. Please use delivery_stack instead.

at.description: When rider's information was last updated.

estimated_arrival_time.description: Estimated time when the rider will arrive at the restaurant.

at.description: Timestamp when the given event occurred.

items.description: Multiple orders can be part of the same delivery journey, this is also known as stacked orders. This field represents an order that is part of this delivery stack.

order_id.description: Represents the order public unique identifier. When order_source is 'FULFILLMENT_API' its value will be the id received during the order creation via Signature API. In other cases it will be Deliveroo's short id.

delivery_priority.description: Represents which order will be delivered first. Orders with lower delivery_priority will be delivery first.

order_source.description: Represents the Deliveroo channel used to place the order.
order_source.title: OrderSource

delivery_status.description: Represents the delivery status of the order
delivery_status.title: DeliveryStatus

200.description: Your server returns this code if it accepts the callback.

4XX.description: Your server can return 4XX codes to signal its issues with the request.

5XX.description: Your server can return 5XX codes to signal its internal issues.

post.description:
This callback is triggered when a rider status is updated.

Usually a regular rider status lifecycle is `rider_assigned` => `rider_arrived (at the restaurant)` => `rider_in_transit (en route to customer)` => `rider_nearby`.

The following are all the valid values for a rider status.

| Rider Status | Description |
| -- | -- |
| `rider_assigned` | Rider was assigned to the order. |
| `rider_unassigned` | Rider was unassigned to the order. |
| `rider_arrived` | Rider nearby to the restaurant. |
| `rider_confirmed_at_restaurant` | Rider arrival at the restaurant confirmed on rider's app. |
| `rider_in_transit` | Rider en route to the customer. |
| `rider_nearby` | Rider is arriving at customer. |

Keep in mind that while every attempt is made to make callbacks in the order they occurred and in a timely manner, neither can be absolutely guaranteed. It is also possible to receive the same callback more than once.

_It is important to notice that these webhooks will only be triggered when rider_status_url configuration entry is set._
